intro: Bigelovia sociata, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit and produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has small, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy and rocky soils. Bigelovia sociata plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for small insects and animals.
